thread.title: Noah Syndergaard ‘100 percent’ sure Mets will win World Series
thread.title_full: Noah Syndergaard ‘100 percent’ sure Mets will win World Series | New York Post

author: Kevin Kernan
title: Noah Syndergaard ‘100 percent’ sure Mets will win World Series
text:
CHICAGO — Noah knows.
Rookie right-hander Noah Syndergaard is a big man with big confidence and he believes the Mets’ sweep of the Cubs in the NLCS is not the end of this Amazin’ ride.
Not even close.
As for how confident Syndergaard is that the Mets will win their third World Series title in franchise history — against the Royals or the Blue Jays, the club that drafted him — Syndergaard left no doubt.
“I’m 100 percent confident,’’ Syndergaard told The Post as teammates poured champagne on one another in the wildest of celebrations after the Mets’ 8-3 win Wednesday night at Wrigley wiped away the Cubs in a four-game sweep in the NLCS.
To make his point crystal clear, Syndergaard repeated his claim.
“One hundred percent,” he said.

Thumbnails Captions OFF Share Share this: Facebook Twitter Google Whatsapp Email More Galleries This was a long journey for Syndergaard, who learned some valuable lessons in spring training about supporting teammates by making sure to be on the bench, even if it’s just an intersquad game.
Once he came to the Mets from Triple-A Las Vegas, Syndergaard was a difference maker, especially in the postseason.
“We have the pitching, the hitting and the defense. We have it all,’’ Syndergaard said.
So get ready for a parade, Mets fans.
flytheM (M is for Murphy/Mets) #LGM 
— Noah Syndergaard (@Noahsyndergaard) October 22, 2015 

“We came into this season a little bit of an underdog, we washed away all those doubts that people had about us,’’ Syndergaard said. “And it was unbelievable challenge as a team but we came together and that made all the difference.
“As pitchers we came together on the mound as well, and we all believe in one another. And I was able to go out there and have the most fun I’ve ever had in my life.’’
He then looked around the room at all the celebrating and joyful faces.
“This is a little bit of heaven right now,’’ Syndergaard said.
More baseball heaven is to come.
